Description: Body sherd of Attic Silhouette pottery open vase, shallow skyphos or top-band stemless cup with base of slightly offset lip; interior glazed black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bearded banqueter in silhouette (lower half missing), reclining to left, holding drinking horn; vines in field.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For a parallels, see Boardman, J., Athenian Black Figure Vases. Oxford 1974, fig. 275 (Haimon Group). The suffix "10" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 366-7, no. B 490) (labelled 1912.37.14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0353) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
